utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Episode 3.01

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle! Down on the ground, now!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you guys reenacting the Humpty Dumpty crime scene?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s the autumnal equinox today.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, and according to Mr. Wizard there, it’s the only time you can balance an egg on its tip.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t you guys have work to do?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, not really.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, now you do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: By the way, the thing with the egg is just urban legend.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not true. I saw Castle do it last year.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s wrong with you? Still no word from him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe you should call him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He said he would be back in the fall and it’s fall, so clearly he has better things to do.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe he’s not back from the Hamptons yet. Maybe he’s still working on his book.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ooh, speaking of Humpty Dumpty.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe somebody tried to stand her up on her head. After all, it is the autumnal equinox.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It wasn’t the fall that killed her. More like multiple gunshot wounds to the torso before doing a Greg Louganis out that window up there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Victim’s name is Chloe Whitman. A couple of pedestrians heard shots and saw the body fall out the window, but when uniforms got here the apartment was empty. There’s no doorman so, so far no one recalls seeing anyone flee the scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, have uniforms start knocking on doors. Find out what else our neighbors didn’t see.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, it’s Castle.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Guess he did finish that book.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Nice of him to send us a copy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like he’s back in town.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nice of him to call.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right guys, you can stop pining for your girlfriend. After all, we’ve got a body full of holes. So what else do we know about our victim?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s got a boyfriend. Evan Murphy. He’s on his way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, let’s go upstairs and see what else we can find.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He really is ruggedly handsome.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: From the spatter patterns she was backing away from the door. After the first bullet hits her, she tries to get away, got nowhere to go but out the window.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So large caliber gun, round goes through her and breaks the glass.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And she goes diving out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks like she was leaving town.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it wasn’t a robbery. Can you check these items for fibers and prints? If we’re lucky there was a struggle.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett? Chloe’s boyfriend Evan is here.

utterance.speaker: EVAN MURPHY
utterance.content: So someone just came here and shot her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, usually in cases like these there is a reason. How long had you and Ms. Whitman been dating?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: About six months.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And was there anyone in her life with violent tendencies? Maybe anyone that she had disputes with?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: No. No, she … the worst thing I ever saw her do was jaywalk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did she do for a living?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: She’s a teacher. Was … a teacher. They all loved her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were you expecting her over tonight?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: No. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, she packed an overnight bag.

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: That … that doesn’t make sense. She has class tomorrow. She wouldn’t just leave without saying anything.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Victim had it in her hand. It was in her fingers so tight I almost didn’t see it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is an address in Tribeca. Could be where she was going.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Only one way to find out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Address is registered to a Maya Santori, 32. She’s clean, no priors.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right there. It’s open.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let me see your hands!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Drop the gun!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Woah!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I … uh …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Down, down! Put it down!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Drop that gun now! Now!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Drop the gun, stupid! Drop it, slimebag!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Woah, okay. Guys, easy. It’s not what it looks like.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It never is. Turn around. Castle, turn around. Richard Castle, you’re under arrest for murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something is different. Did you remodel?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’ve been informed of your rights, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? You’re not even going to ask me how my summer was?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You are aware that you’re under arrest, for murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I thought you were being rough with the cuffs just for fun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You look good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You look good, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why are you so mad at me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe because you were found standing over a dead body with a gun in your hand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but I told you, she was dead when I got there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why didn’t you call?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was going to call you. But then you showed up before I could.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really. Well then why did we find you in our victim’s apartment?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, because she called me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, so you and Ms. Santori were in a relationship.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I wouldn’t say it was a relationship. I bought a couple of sculptures from her …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were you sleeping with her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How is that relevant?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Motive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. No. I wasn’t. Sleeping with her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure? Beautiful woman –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m in a relationship.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: With who?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that a new lipstick?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know with whom.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How should I know? I haven’t seen you in months. You could have been in dozens of relationships with women since then.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You sound jealous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jealous? Of you dating your ex-wife and publisher. Tell me, does she make you do everything on a deadline?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So how about you? You still with that cop boyfriend of yours? What was his name again? Demming?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You broke up?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This victim that called you, what was it about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She said she was in trouble and she couldn’t go to the police.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So why did she call you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because Maya knew I had a relationship with you- uh, with the NYPD. She thought I could help.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Help how?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, she didn’t say. She just told me to come over. When I got there the door was open, the place was trashed, she was dead on the bed, and there was a gun on the floor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you, being the expert veteran of dozens of crime scenes, decided to pick up the murder weapon to - what? Ensure that we had your prints?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe you missed the part where I said she was shot dead. When I heard the noises coming from the next room I thought maybe whoever killed her was coming back. So I picked up the gun to defend myself. It seemed like a very good idea at the time. That’s when you, Esposito, and Annie Oakley come bursting through the door.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Annie Oakley?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I kinda almost shot Castle. What? He had a gun.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Should’ve let you shoot him. Would have served him right for not calling.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So tell me, why should I believe you, considering that you pretty much make up stories for a living?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because you know me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know her? Chloe Whitman. She was shot to death. Your friend’s address was found in her hand after she was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Another murder. What’s the connection?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. You were the one with the gun, you tell me.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Beckett, a word?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Captain. How’s it going.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What, you too? Really? C’mon, guys.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: CSU recovered the slugs from Maya Santori and Chloe Whitman’s place. The gun was a .45, Castle was holding a .38.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So it must have belonged to the victim for self defense. Which means that Castle was telling the truth.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: But I’d be happy to hold him if you’d like.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re free to go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What, that’s it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bullets don’t match your gun. You’re off the hook.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what’s our next move?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There isn’t one, at least not for you. You’re going home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Woah, woah, woah. Two victims, one of them an acquaintance of mine and you’re sending me home?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re a witness, Castle. I can’t have you involved.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m already involved.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle! Go home. Go back to your Hamptons, your ex-wife, your book parties. Okay? I’ve got work to do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did I do?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Darling, hello! Oh, you must see this video. It’s absolutely charming.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: A penguin smacks another penguin into an ice hole. I’ll show you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, maybe later.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ooh, you look as though someone smacked you into an ice hole.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I stopped by the precinct.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I thought you weren’t going back until after the book tour.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, well, fate intervened. Someone I know was murdered today.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, lord.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, that’s awful. Who?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maya. The woman who made that sculpture for me.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Any leads?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Not yet.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: So, how is everyone? Beckett have a nice summer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, everyone is fine.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Now why don’t I believe you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Aren’t you with Chet on Tuesdays?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, that was never set in stone. Besides, Alexis is in crisis. The young man from the summer program still hasn’t called her.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Despite the fact that he said we’d talk when he got back from Europe, which he already did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well if you knew he was back, why don’t you just call him?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He’s the one that went away. I mean, if he still cared he would have called.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he was going to, but he didn’t know how you’d feel about him. Maybe he was worried that something had changed while he was away.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, Richard Castle, that is the stupidest thing I’ve ever heard. Have I taught you nothing about relationships?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re a shining example. Just how big a deal is this anyway?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I don’t even know if I want to see him anymore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh c’mon. You’re not even giving him a chance.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Why are you siding with him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not! I just … maybe he’ll do something that will make it right. Maybe he’ll just … maybe he’ll surprise you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Maybe he missed his chance.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If you ask me, you should have locked him up just out of spite.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, that would be unethical. Making the people down in Holding deal with him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: True.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, so, ballistics ran a comparison of the slugs from the two murders. They’re from the same gun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything on the canvass?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Police showed Chloe’s photos to Maya’s friends and neighbors – they don’t recognize her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And Chloe’s boyfriend and her colleagues from her prep school, they don’t know Maya either.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so, we’ve got a high school chemistry teacher and a sculptor who live on two different sides of town and by all accounts run in completely different circles. They’re both killed on the same day and by the same person. Their lives must intersect somehow. All right, run phones and financials, let’s see if anything pops.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: On it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m gonna go and see Lanie and see if she’s found anything.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ryan!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, LT.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER LT
utterance.content: Hey, Castle. Back on the beat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, looking that way. Is Beckett here?

utterance.speaker: OFFICER LT
utterance.content: Finished her sweep about an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She find anything?

utterance.speaker: OFFICER LT
utterance.content: Nothing useful.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mind if I take a look around?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, brother, it looks like you missed one.

utterance.speaker: CSU TECH
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Hey. I hear you made an interesting arrest today. You want to talk about it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Okay. You keep holding that stuff in, you’re going to get an ulcer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything unusual?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: You mean, besides the gunshots?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. I’m looking for anything that will connect these two victims.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: They both had tattoos.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Everyone has tattoos.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Chloe Whitman, our jumper, has a rose and Ms. Santori has a mermaid on her back. Looking at the work, it could be the same tattoo artist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything else?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It may be nothing, but I found this on Ms. Whitman’s hand.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Could be an apartment number, gym locker code … and looking at how faded it is, I’d say she wrote it about a week ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Oh, and … I found these in Ms. Santori’s pocket.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cab receipts?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Dated today, just a few hours before she was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll call up the cab company and see if we can retrace her whereabouts.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Are you sure you don’t want to talk about it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Positive! Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, we just got the phone records back on our vics. Turns out, they did have a connection. They both received phone calls from the same number within hours of their deaths.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were you able to run it down?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, it traced back to a Todd McHutchin. He’s got priors including a robbery and domestic assault.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You got an address?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, we’ve got an address.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let me see your hands! I said let me see your hands.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, hi.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can explain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Turn around.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, would you just listen to me, please?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why? You don’t listen to me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, I was doing some digging around on my own. That’s not a crime, is it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, but criminal trespassing is. And so is murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was just trying to help.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t need your help. How did you get here anyway?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was following up a lead, same as you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, really? So you subpoenaed the victim’s phone records and looked for commonalities?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, not exactly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah! I star six-nine’d. I star six-nine’d.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You star sixty-nine’d?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. On Maya’s phone. I figured it would give me her last call. Rang up McHutchin here, I got his name from his voicemail, and then I did a web search. Tell me you’re not impressed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You went to an active crime scene without authorization.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … yeah. But I wore gloves.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Beckett. This body’s cold. He’s been dead for hours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See? I didn’t kill him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Slugs?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ll have to run ballistics, but the entry wounds are the same size as our other vics.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Odd.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, the guy is in vending machines. Not an obvious choice to be running around with artist and a prep school teacher.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so let’s get CSU down here to look for fibers and prints and have them start looking for commonalities between the three crime scenes. Let’s start digging into their lives. If they were on the same dating site, I want to know. If they were in the same twelve step program, I want to know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can I help?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, Castle, I’m sorry about your friend. I really am. But that doesn’t mean that you can show up and act like nothing has happened. The truth is, if you wanted to come back you would’ve already, but you didn’t, so let’s just face it. The only reason that you’re here right now is because you were at the wrong place at the wrong time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you ever stop and think I was waiting to hear from you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you know what these bodies are? A sign.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A sign.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A sign … a sign from the universe telling us we need to solve this case together. You don’t want to let the universe down, do you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re not going to go away no matter what I do, are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I respect the universe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. I will let you join me, on this one case, as long as you promise to do what I say when I say it, and not to do any investigating on your own.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I promise. You won’t regret this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I already do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Starting now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is it about the refrigerator? Is it the cold, the light, or a combination of the two?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I can’t sleep.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, the boy.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He finally called.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Great!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I didn’t answer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I was mad. I thought he’d leave a message, but he didn’t, so now what do I do? He knows I know he called, but if I call back right away then clearly I’m admitting I was waiting for his call. How long do I need to wait to call him back? A day? At least a day … maybe two?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe you should get a new boyfriend and start over.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You’re not very good at this, are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Apparently not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anything?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, we tracked down Todd McHutchin’s fiancée, she’s on her way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Find anything in their background checks?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we went as far back as grade school and nothing has popped yet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe they were top CIA agents targeted for termination.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: CIA is a popular theory with you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes well, law of averages demands that I’ll eventually be right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’d forgotten how helpful your insights can be.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh yeah? I bet I figure out how they’re connected before you do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, you’re on. But if I win, you have to promise to go away and never interfere with any of my cases again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine. And if I win, you have to take me back as your partner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Deal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if they figure it out first?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT_CASTLE
utterance.content: Nah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What are you two talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle was just apologizing for not calling.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what did you guys find?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Forensics on that blood smear that Castle found in Maya’s apartment. It’s a match to Todd McHutchin.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: CSU found some of McHutchin’s blood on Maya’s shoe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means that your friend was at his place either during or after the murder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ran down those cab receipts from her pocket – according to the taxi company they picked her up outside McHutchin’s apartment yesterday morning and took her somewhere in the Bowery.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bowery?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was just after that that she called me.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Beckett, McHutchin’s fiancée is here.

utterance.speaker: ANA
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I’ve never seen them before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your fiancée had a record. Is it possible he was involved in … … uh, anything illegal?

utterance.speaker: ANA
utterance.content: Todd was a good man. I know he did some bad things in the past, but he got himself his own business. He was totally legit now. Only …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Only what?

utterance.speaker: ANA
utterance.content: A couple months ago Todd hurt his back and couldn’t work. The bank wanted to take away his business, so … he borrowed some money from a guy in the neighborhood. This guy, he’s no good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he threaten Todd?

utterance.speaker: ANA
utterance.content: Todd was making payments, but he fell behind. A couple weeks back, the man came to the house with a gun. He said he was going to kill Todd if he didn’t pay back what he’d owed.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: I loaned him money. Fifteen G’s, so what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Carbino, we have a witness that says you threatened to kill him.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So now he’s dead.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I can see that. Look Detective, first off, fifteen G’s is not an amount of money worth killing for. Not unless you have exhausted other avenues, to which I had not. And secondly, and more to the point, your boy here, he paid me back the entire sum, plus interest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you really expect me to believe that?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: No, I don’t, sweetheart. But that don’t mean it ain’t true.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: His alibi checks. He was in Jersey all day yesterday shopping at Short Hills with the missus.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. Lucky girl.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Doesn’t mean he didn’t do it. Could’ve hired someone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, to kill McHutchin, but why Maya and Chloe?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe they witnessed the hit.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe they cosigned the loan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do we have McHutchin’s financials?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, they should all be up shortly. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, well, Carbino said that, uh, McHutchin paid off his debt in full plus interest. I was just thinking that was a lot of money for a guy in the vending machine business and I thought maybe where did that money come from.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, all of McHutchin’s accounts were overdrawn and then suddenly two weeks ago $9500 appears in his savings.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Two weeks ago?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, on the, uh, the 7th.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There was a deposit in Maya Santori’s account on the 7th for the same amount.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about Chloe Whitman?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: $9500, deposited on the 7th.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means they were all receiving money from the same source.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And spending it in the same place. Both Maya Santori and Chloe Whitman had charges on their credit card for a place called KCBC, both of them on the 9th and the 16th. Both of them small amounts, less than $20.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Same thing with McHutchin.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The restaurant where they met?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Call up the bank, see if they can help us track who made those deposits, and I’d like to contact the credit card company to find out what this KCBC is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: On it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t think that this means that you won the bet. All we know is that they are connected. We still don’t know how.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I missed you, too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, bad news. According to the banks, our victim’s deposits were made in cash. There’s no way to trace the payments. And since the deposits were less than ten thousand dollars, there was no report made to the IRS.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means that our victims were most likely involved in something illegal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just so you know, I got that from ‘shot to death’.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So? So, what illegal activity involves vending machines, an artist, and a high school teacher?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know. Even the stuff I’m making up in my head doesn’t make sense.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I talked to the credit card companies. KCBC bills to an internet card processing service. There’s no address on file.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We can’t even track it down?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I didn’t say that. There’s no address on file, but they do register the ISP of every swiped card transaction that goes through. So I had tech track it down. Whoever ran those charges did so from this address. I got this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? Road trip.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You sure this is the place?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: As sure as you are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This doesn’t look like a credit card kind of place. This looks more like a get shot and robbed kind of place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s the number on Chloe’s hand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This place, it’s like the circus, with alcohol. How have I never been here before?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You think this is crazy, you should see some of the clubs that I’ve been to.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: What can I get you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Information. Do you recognize these people?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Yeah, they’re part of Kitty’s burlesque troupe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kitty’s troupe?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Kitty Canary. She runs the place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where can I find this Kitty?

utterance.speaker: KITTY
utterance.content: They’re really dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m afraid so. Your bartender said that they were part of your troupe.

utterance.speaker: KITTY
utterance.content: Chloe would dance from time to time, Todd had a snake act.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about Maya?

utterance.speaker: KITTY
utterance.content: She was more of a patron. She came for inspiration.

utterance.speaker: EARL
utterance.content: Hey, just heard.

utterance.speaker: KITTY
utterance.content: Detective, this is my husband, Earl. He runs the burlesque with me.

utterance.speaker: EARL
utterance.content: Do you know what happened?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re looking into it. Right now, the only connection we can find is this club.

utterance.speaker: KITTY
utterance.content: You don’t think someone here killed them?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How well did you know them?

utterance.speaker: KITTY
utterance.content: They were work friends. You know, “hi, how are you”. Although, Maya and Chloe did come to the shop once to get tattoos. My day job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did the three of them spend a lot of time together?

utterance.speaker: EARL
utterance.content: No more so than anybody else.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did they spend a lot of time with anyone else here?

utterance.speaker: KITTY
utterance.content: Not that I noticed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have a mailing list of your regulars?

utterance.speaker: EARL
utterance.content: Yes. I can get a copy if you want.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes and I’ll also need a list of all your employees and any other members of your troupe.

utterance.speaker: KITTY
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you think of any other connection between the three of them?

utterance.speaker: KITTY
utterance.content: Well, there was the incident.

utterance.speaker: EARL
utterance.content: A couple of weeks ago Chloe’s boyfriend came around. Apparently he didn’t like her dancing here. He got a little rough. Both Maya and Todd intervened.

utterance.speaker: KITTY
utterance.content: Evan was drunk, yelling all kinds of crazy stuff.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of stuff?

utterance.speaker: KITTY
utterance.content: ‘I know what you’re doing. I know all about it.’ I guess he thought she was screwing someone else.

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: Okay, so, I followed Chloe to the club that night. But only because she was acting weird. Secretive. And I thought she was seeing another guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Murphy, why didn’t you tell us this before?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: That I was fighting with my girlfriend? That I’d threatened her? I know how cops work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And when you found out about the other victims? That they were all there at the club?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: I didn’t kill her! I didn’t kill any of them! What would you have done?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I would try to help find her killer.

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: But … if I had told you then what you know now, would you have looked any further than me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Murphy, the money in Chloe’s account, where did it come from?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: What money?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he admits to the fights and the threats, but he claims to not know anything about the money.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or anything about how our victims are connected other than the events of that night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you believe him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Doesn’t matter what I believe. He’s a viable suspect. Hey Ryan, I need you to get a search warrant for Evan Murphy’s place. And Esposito, how are things going over there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We ran the club’s mailing list for people with priors, these are the ones that have popped so far.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, run them for any connections with our vics.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve seen this guy’s face.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the same guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maya knew him. Xander Doyle, weapons charges, conspiracy to distribute, and apparently he lives in the Bowery.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How much you want to bet Maya was on her way to see him after McHutchin’s murder?

utterance.speaker: XANDER
utterance.content: Yeah, I knew Maya. Met her at the club a few months back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what was the nature of your relationship?

utterance.speaker: XANDER
utterance.content: She said she liked the way I looked. You know how it goes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When was the last time you saw her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Doyle, we have evidence that indicates that Maya came to see you the day she died.

utterance.speaker: XANDER
utterance.content: Look, she said she was in trouble, needed my help.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of trouble?

utterance.speaker: XANDER
utterance.content: She wouldn’t say. Someone must have been after her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why would you say that?

utterance.speaker: XANDER
utterance.content: Because the reason she came to see me is that she wanted to borrow a gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s why she was armed. She saw what happened to McHutchin, she figured she’d be next.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Doyle, did Maya give you any indication as to what she might have been involved in?

utterance.speaker: XANDER
utterance.content: No. If I was a betting man … I ran into Maya a few weeks ago on the street. She gave me a hug, I could smell it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You could smell what?

utterance.speaker: XANDER
utterance.content: That sick smell. Paint thinner, acetone, bleach. I’ve got a buddy that smells like that. You know what he does? He makes meth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s so obvious. I can’t believe I didn’t think of it sooner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you really think it was meth?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s the only thing that makes any sense. All of our victims were struggling financially. One night after the club closes they’re all together, talking about their money woes, until our high school chemistry teacher cracks a smile and says ‘well, we could always make meth’. But the others don’t laugh. They say ‘yeah, we could make meth’. Just like that cable show. I’m telling you, it’s drugs.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s not drugs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yes. And your guy was right about the chemicals. I found trace amounts of bleach, acetone, sodium chloride, and ammonia on all three bodies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So how can you tell that it’s not drugs?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Because of what’s missing. If your guys had been cooking up meth or any other street lab drugs there, would be other substances present, not to mention the trace amounts of the finished product. That being said, they were definitely up to something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hum. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, it’s Ryan. That search warrant on Evan Murphy’s place? It paid off. We found the murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: I swear to God I’ve never seen that before in my life!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then what was it doing in your place?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: I don’t know!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What really happened the night you followed Chloe to the club?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: I told you, we fought!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: About what? And do not say the affair. What were the four of you in to? Evan, what’s the connection? Why did you kill them?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: I want a lawyer. I’m not saying anything else without a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: PD’s office has been notified. They’re sending someone over.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, notify the DA. Maybe they can cut us a deal and help us figure out what was really going on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know that look.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What look?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That ‘something doesn’t add up’ look.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s just the lab report on the murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They didn’t find any fingerprints.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He probably wiped it down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would he wipe it down if he was going to hang on to it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he was going to ditch it but didn’t get around to it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm, ditching it would be the first thing that he would do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he thought he still needed it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To kill someone else?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or protect himself.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey yo Beckett, financials came back on your boy Evan. There’s no unusual activity.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe that was his motive. Whatever it was they were up to, he didn’t get his cut.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But what was his cut? I mean, what the hell were they in to? It’s like a bad joke – a sculptor, a vending machine salesman, and a chemistry teacher walk into a burlesque bar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, only we don’t have a punchline.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Only that they made a lot of money and got themselves killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Made a bunch of money.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A sculptor who works with metal, a chemist, and a vending machine operator. I think I know what our victims were up to. Do we still have Chloe’s purse?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you looking for?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Aha! Take a look at the serial numbers on those bills.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They’re the same.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These bills are all pre-1998.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s before they redesigned the currency.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s our punch line. That’s how these people are connected. In counterfeiting, the hardest thing to make is the paper. But they had all the paper they needed. They had an unlimited supply of one dollar bills.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: From the vending machines.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And those chemicals we found on our victim’s bodies?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were used to whitewash the singles to make blank bank notes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A procedure requiring the expertise of a chemist. And what do counterfeiters do with blank bank notes?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Print larger denominations, for which they’d need a metal press plate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And who better than to provide that than a sculptor?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So … plates, paper … there’s only one missing ingredient.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE_BECKETT
utterance.content: I know who the killer is!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: KITTY
utterance.content: C’mon! Hurry up!

utterance.speaker: KITTY
utterance.content: Get the plates. The plates!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Going somewhere? Let me see your hands. Step away from the bags and walk forward.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, they’re fake.

utterance.speaker: KITTY
utterance.content: What gave me away?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The missing ingredient. Ink. And who better to provide it than a tattoo artist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That and Evan Murphy. You knew we’d follow up after you told us that story. So you planted that gun but you didn’t have enough time to put his prints on it, did you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look out!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Go, go! Get him!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Move, move, move!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let’s go!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’s Kitty?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The money’s gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You stay here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if they come back?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey! Hey!

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle! Down on the ground, now!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They hatched the plan late one night at the club. They figured ‘victimless crime’ and nobody would get hurt.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kitty and Earl would launder the bills through the club and then make cash payments to the others.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Sounds like they had a sweet deal going on. How did it all go wrong?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Todd McHutchin. He was getting squeezed by a loan shark, figured he’d try to make a payment with counterfeit bills.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The shark threatened to rat him out unless he turned over the operation. Maya and Chloe were willing but Kitty and Earl weren’t. And when Todd confronted them he had no idea who he was dealing with.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Kitty Canary, aka Carla Rieser.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was a stripper in Seattle. She did a nickel for a manslaughter charge for trying to run over her boyfriend and when she got out she got a new name, new boyfriend, and even changed coasts. She wasn’t the type of girl to let Todd take her down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They had everything they needed. Chemical formulas, the plates, all they had to do was get rid of the others.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Nice work you two. Very impressive. But tomorrow I want you to tell me the story about how Castle got your gun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So uh, I guess you won the bet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But look, if you don’t want –
